Description: A hollow terracotta figure of a literate monkey seated on a high-backed chair, wearing only a hooded cloak, and writing on a papyrus scroll resting on its knees. Details of hair and chair were incised after the object left the mould, before firing. Minor treatment at back. The muzzle is damaged. Two-piece mould. Orange-brown Nile silt with little or no mica; darker brown surface. There are traces of a white dressing.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Ptolemaic, third or second century BC. Comparandum: Head of monkey wearing hood similar to ours: Fischer 1994: no. 1143, dated second half of second century AD. Bibliog: Fischer 1994: no. 523.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3778)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
